Electronic calculators may be used. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 767, 560]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 604, 585]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 759, 600]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 644, 905, 841]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 852, 839, 865]]<|/det|> This syllabus is approved for use in England, Wales and Northern Ireland as a Cambridge International Level 1/Level 2 Certificate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 874, 665, 890]]<|/det|> This document consists of 12 printed pages.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 828, 89]]<|/det|> In this experiment, you will determine the mass of a metre rule by a balancing method. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 576, 121]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 1.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[89, 135, 907, 280]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 297, 532, 316]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 330, 144, 348]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 329, 920, 378]]<|/det|> Place the metre rule on the pivot. Place block \(\mathbf{Q}\) on the metre rule with its centre at the \(95.0 \text{cm}\) mark. Keep \(\mathbf{Q}\) at the \(95.0 \text{cm}\) mark and adjust the position of the metre rule on the pivot until the metre rule is as near to being balanced as possible. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 392, 920, 409]]<|/det|> The distance \(a\) between the centre of \(\mathbf{Q}\) and the \(50.0 \text{cm}\) mark has been recorded in Table 1.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 422, 532, 440]]<|/det|> In the table, record the position of the pivot \(\mathbf{P}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 453, 841, 471]]<|/det|> Calculate the distance \(b\) between the centre of \(\mathbf{Q}\) and the pivot \(\mathbf{P}\), using the formula <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[358, 484, 640, 502]]<|/det|> \[b = (\text{position of } \mathbf{Q} - \text{position of } \mathbf{P}).\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 515, 920, 547]]<|/det|> Repeat the procedure for positions of \(\mathbf{Q}\) at the \(90.0 \text{cm}\), \(85.0 \text{cm}\), \(80.0 \text{cm}\) and \(75.0 \text{cm}\) marks. Record your values for the position of \(\mathbf{P}\) and your values for \(b\) in the table. <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 561, 539, 579]]<|/det|> Table 1.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 588, 751, 766]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate how the volume of water affects the rate at which water in a beaker cools.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 576, 137]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 303, 920, 336]]<|/det|>
Another student wants to investigate whether more thermal energy is lost from the water surface than from the sides of the beakers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 350, 667, 368]]<|/det|>
Describe an experiment that could be done to investigate this.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 381, 561, 399]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 411, 566, 429]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A student is investigating the factors that affect the size of the crater (hole) a ball makes when it is dropped into sand.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment which would enable you to investigate one factor which might affect the size of the crater. You are **not** required to carry out the experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 398, 183]]<|/det|>
The apparatus available includes:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 197, 390, 212]]<|/det|>
metal balls of different sizes

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 212, 277, 228]]<|/det|>
a tray of sand.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 243, 378, 259]]<|/det|>
Write a plan for the experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 274, 324, 291]]<|/det|>
In your plan, you should:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 305, 138, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>*</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 305, 482, 322]]<|/det|>
state which factor is being investigated,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 336, 138, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>*</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 336, 534, 353]]<|/det|>
state the key variables that you would control,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 138, 384]]<|/det|>
<label>*</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 368, 460, 384]]<|/det|>
list any additional apparatus needed,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 399, 136, 416]]<|/det|>
<label>*</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 399, 920, 431]]<|/det|>
explain briefly how you would carry out the experiment including what would be measured and how this would be done,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 446, 136, 463]]<|/det|>
<label>*</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 446, 725, 463]]<|/det|>
state the precautions which should be taken to obtain reliable results,
